column5: Welcome to the conversation and thanks for joining.
We're going to get started in a few minutes once enough people have a chance to join. Please sit tight.
A few more minutes and we'll get started
One more minute and we'll begin. Thanks for your patience.
Lets begin!

We are working to develop policies that will govern the next generation of AI. We believe policies governing AI should be determined by democratic inputs, not just the people in power. Our hope is that through this conversation we can learn your views and use them to shape such policies.
Your responses and votes today could have real impact on how the AI systems behave, so please be thoughtful and honest in your participation.
The specific issue we want to discuss today is: How should an AI assistant handle requests for medical advice?
So what is an AI assistant?

Modern AI assistants are powerful chatbots trained on nearly everything on the internet. This enables them to understand human language, and gives them knowledge of basically everything that can be found on the internet. You can think of them sort of like extremely knowledgeable and creative chatbots.
A few examples of modern AI assistants are ChatGPT , Claud, and Bard.
AI assistants can answer questions about nearly any topic. For example:
They can give instructions on how to do something.
They can write a computer program for you.
They can even write poetry.
They are good enough at conversation that people even treat them like friends or romantic partners!
Overall modern AI assistants are extremely powerful and capable conversational assistants. However, they can also randomly provide inaccurate information about people, places, or facts.
So what is the challenge of deciding how an AI assistant handles requests for medical advice?
Sometimes the AI might give advice that is spot on, or slightly off, or even totally wrong.

And sometimes being wrong may have no real consequences (like if it suggests you drink 10% more water than is ideal), yet other times being wrong could kill a person (like if it suggest you take a lethal dose of some medicine).
On the other hand, for people who don't have good access to a doctor, the medical advice an AI might provide could be really helpful and even save their life.
So how should an AI assistant handle requests for medical advice?

Now it's your turn to think! We will ask you a series of questions to get you thinking about medical advice and the role of AI. At the end, based on what you learned in the previous questions, you will come up with a recommendation about when the AI should and should not refuse a request for medical advice.

To help you start thinking about how an AI assistant handles requests for medical advice, I want you to think about what personal experiences that you or people you know personally have with medical advice which might inform your views.

Can you share a positive experience involving medical advice which you think is relevant to this discussion?
(Please do not share any personally identifiable information!)
Here are some responses representative of the group:

Can you share a negative experience involving medical advice which you think is relevant to this discussion?
(Please do not share any personally identifiable information!)
Here are some responses representative of the group:

Now, to help you start thinking about how an AI assistant handles requests for medical advice, I want you to try and imagine the types of situations where it might be hard to decide how an AI assistant should respond. 
You can be creative! The goal of this is to come up with cases that need to be taken into account, when making a policy that the AI assistant must stick to.
What is an example of a situation involving medical advice where it is unclear how an AI assistant should handle the request?
Here are some responses representitive of the group:

Now I want you to think about what factors the AI should take into account when determining how to handle requests for medical advice. 
For example:
Whether the person has access to a real doctor
What the risks are of giving the wrong advice
Whether the advice comes from peer-reviewed publications or not
What factors should an AI consider when dealing with medical advice inquiries?
Here are some responses representitive of the group:

Now I want you to think about the different ways an AI assistant could respond to a medical advice request. 
For example:
Refuse to give an answer
Give a range of different advice for the user to assess themselves
Give an answer but clarify how confident it is in that answer 
Offer relevant knowledge with scientific consensus but don't give advice
What is a good option for how an AI assistant could respond to a tricky medical advice request?
Here are some responses representitive of the group:

Now I want you to think about specific policies you think an AI assistant should follow when responding to a medical advice request. 
A good policy should be in the form of: "If [situation] then [what AI should do]"
For example: 
If there is no scientific consensus on an issue, then the AI should give a range of information so the user can make their own decision
If someone's life is at stake, then the AI should only give advice if it comes from a reputable medical journal.
If someone is asking for a diagnosis, then the AI should ask follow-up questions to better understand a person's symptoms, then suggest a range of possible diagnoses.

In the next question we're going to ask you to provide a specific policy an AI assistant should follow when responding to medical advice. 
(We will ask you the same question again, to come up with another policy after this, so you don't need to include everything in one policy!)

What is one specific policy you think an AI assistant should follow when responding to a medical advice request? 
Use the same format as above: "If [situation] then [what AI should do]."
Now we'll ask the same question again so you can contribute another policy.

What is a specific policy you think an AI assistant should follow when responding to a medical advice request? 
Use the same format as above: "If [situation] then [what AI should do]."
Now, I want you to think about situations where an AI assistant should always refuse to provide medical advice. Be creative, and remember the experiences that people mentioned earlier!
What is one situation where the AI assistant should always refuse to provide medical information or advice?
Finally, I want you to think about situations where an AI assistant should never refuse to provide medical advice.
What is one situation where the AI assistant should never refuse to provide medical information or advice?
I see many of you are split on what to do in emergency situations.
How do you think the AI should handle requests for medical advice in emergency situations?
Thank you all so much for your participation and responses.
What are we going to do with all this data?

We are going to take everything we learned here today and use it to craft an initial set of policies that can go into an AI's constitution. Then we're going to run additional sessions to refine those policies and assess the public's support for them overall.
So now that you have had a chance to think about what AI can do and how it can be regulated, do you think AI will be_____?
Once last question before we go...
Was there anything that was particularly confusing, or difficult in this session? What should we change if we did it again?
Thanks again, and hope you have a great rest of your day Click here to return to Prolific and redeem your reward.
